acf.quote: IOM hopes to make it easier for its field staff to share data through HDX and to increase the interoperability of this data by using the Humanitarian Exchange Language (HXL).
acf.source: IOM and OCHA: Partners in Displacement Data

acf.quote: By tagging the data columns in the csv with HXL (Humanitarian Exchange Language) tags, … data structures trigger quick data visualizations via the HDX dashboard.
acf.source: Data @ IFRC: How can we be locally data-driven? (#14)

acf.quote: Blog: A Field Test Of HXL During Guinea’s Ebola Epidemic
acf.source: A Field Test Of HXL During Guinea’s Ebola Epidemic

acf.quote: For datasets relevant to emergency response, use the Humanitarian Exchange Language (HXL) as a starting point for terminology and taxonomies to enable data sharing.
